record.dc:title: Gatlinburg From All Sides
record.dc:creator: Sturley, Ruth
record.dc:description: This scrapbook, which consists of 139 images, was assembled by Pi Beta Phi Settlement School teacher and Tacoma, Washington native Ruth Sturley in 1919. The book chronicles Sturley's nine month tenure in Gatlinburg, and includes images of the Settlement School, students, neighboring homesteads, and mountain vistas. It is currently housed in the archives of the Arrowmont School of Arts and Crafts.
record.dc:subject: People
Landscape
Community

Expansion and Growth of Pi Beta Phi Settlement School, Gatlinburg, Tennessee, 1928-1943
record.dc:source: Arrowmont School of Arts and Crafts, Archives Collection, Box 68.
